How to interpret the result of Forecast in R

I am working on Daily time series forecasting starts from 1-1-2016 to 31-08-2018, For such long series I have used below approach to forecasting for next 30 days. x Where I am getting the desiered results as expected... Forecast method: ARIMA(1,1,1)(0,1,0)[365] Model Information: Series: x ARIMA(1,1,1)(0,1,0)[365] Coefficients: ar1 ma1 0.3771 -0.9760 s.e. 0.0411 0.0123 sigma^2 estimated as 164061: log likelihood=-4516.73 AIC=9039.46 AICc=9039.5 BIC=9052.69 Error measures: ME RMSE MAE MPE MAPE MASE ACF1 Training set 9.542325 319.4919 176.8696 -19.14952 39.12223 0.5240848 -0.01867405 Forecasts: Point Forecast Lo 80 Hi 80 Lo 95 Hi 95 2018.6685 774.3854 255.29962 1293.4711 -19.487785 1568.259 2018.6712 957.2433 397.95021 1516.5364 101.878323 1812.608 2018.6740 950.2112 383.56386 1516.8586 83.598862 1816.824 2018.6767 871.5679 302.99223 1440.1435 2.006462 1741.129 2018.6795 765.9185 196.54592 1335.2911 -104.861727 1636.699 2018.6822 887.0847 317.21373 1456.9556 15.542277 1758.627 2018.6849 882.1492 -580.663474 1188.299 My Questions are as below 1.How to interpret 2018.6685 etc in forecast results 2.How to reduce errors(MAPE).
